abstract: American hurdler Aries Merritt, who underwent kidney transplant after winning gold medal at 2012 London Olympics, hopes to qualify for 2016 Rio Games; improbable and grueling comeback from rare and severe kidney disease culminated in third-place finish at world championships in Beijing four days before receiving kidney donated by his sister.
lead_paragraph: Aries Merritt, an Olympic gold medalist in the 110-meter hurdles in 2012 and a kidney transplant recipient in 2015, is trying to qualify for the team again, beginning Friday.

headline.print_headline: Disease Won’t Stand in This Hurdler’s Way
headline.main: Olympic Hurdler Isn’t Letting Disease Stand in His Way

snippet: Aries Merritt, an Olympic gold medalist in the 110-meter hurdles in 2012 and a kidney transplant recipient in 2015, is trying to qualify for the team again, beginning Friday....
